definition: Showing love or warm feelings in a gentle way.
examples: The puppy is very affectionate with children.
He gave his gran an affectionate hug.

extra.memory_tip: Affectionate = full of affection to share.

definition: To ask strongly for help or a decision; to be attractive or interesting; a serious request or legal challenge.
examples: They appealed for donations after the storm. (verb)
The park’s appeal is its quiet paths. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Appeal = a pull toward help or interest.

definition: To hold tightly; a device for fastening.
examples: She clasped his hand as they crossed the road. (verb)
The necklace has a tiny clasp. (noun)

definition: Easy to notice; standing out clearly.
examples: Her red coat was conspicuous in the crowd.
There was a conspicuous error on the sign.

definition: To give (time, money, effort) or to help cause something.
examples: Everyone contributed ideas to the project.
Good sleep contributes to better learning.

extra.memory_tip: Contribute = add your bit to the group.

definition: To announce clearly and formally; to state openly.
examples: They declared the results after counting.
You must declare items at customs.

extra.memory_tip: Declare = make it clear to all.

definition: Expressing ideas clearly and beautifully, especially in speech.
examples: Her eloquent speech moved the audience.
An eloquent look passed between them.

definition: To show publicly; a public display or object on show.
examples: Students will exhibit their artwork on Friday. (verb)
The museum’s new dinosaur exhibit is popular. (noun)

definition: A boat that carries people or goods across water; to carry people or goods by boat or vehicle.
examples: We took the ferry to the island. (noun)
Buses ferried fans to the stadium. (verb)

definition: A person who moves to a new country to live there.
examples: Immigrants bring skills and stories with them.
Her grandparents were immigrants from Italy.

definition: Very tall or high; noble or proud in manner or ideas.
examples: Lofty mountains ringed the valley.
She set herself lofty goals.

extra.memory_tip: Lofty = up in the loft, high above.

definition: A base or support that a statue or object stands on; a high position of respect.
examples: The statue stood on a marble pedestal.
Don’t put anyone on a pedestal.

extra.memory_tip: Pedestal = pedestal supports the ‘pedal’ feet of a statue.

definition: To treat someone cruelly or unfairly, especially because of their beliefs or identity.
examples: They were persecuted for their religion.
Laws were passed to protect groups from persecution.

definition: To bring legal action against someone for a crime; to carry out an activity with determination.
examples: The state decided to prosecute the suspect for fraud.
Despite setbacks, the team prosecuted the research to completion.

extra.memory_tip: PROSecute = take someone to court to PROve a case.

definition: The state of being very poor; not having enough for basic needs.
examples: The charity works to reduce poverty.
Poverty affects access to education.

definition: To remove a covering and show something; to make known for the first time.
examples: They unveiled the new statue in the square.
The company will unveil its latest device tomorrow.

extra.memory_tip: Unveil = take off the veil so all can see.
